title_full: IOTSEC01-BP01 Assign unique identities to each IoT device
title: Assign unique identities to each IoT device
description: When a device connects to other devices or cloud services, it must establish trust by authenticating using credentials such as X.509 certificates (with proof of having the private key) or security tokens. Each device should have a unique name in the device registry, and each device should have an associated unique identity principal. Identity principals should not be shared between devices.

title_full: IOTSEC02-BP01 Use a separate hardware or a secure area on your devices to store credentials
title: Use a separate hardware or a secure area on your devices to store credentials
description: Secure device credentials by using separate hardware security modules (HSM) or secure areas on devices to store private keys and sensitive identity information. This prevents unauthorized access to credentials even if the device firmware is compromised.

title_full: IOTSEC02-BP02 Use a trusted platform module (TPM) to implement cryptographic controls
title: Use a trusted platform module (TPM) to implement cryptographic controls
description: Implement cryptographic controls using a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) on IoT devices. TPMs provide hardware-based security for key generation, storage, and cryptographic operations, protecting against software-based attacks on device credentials.

title_full: IOTSEC02-BP03 Use protected boot and persistent storage encryption
title: Use protected boot and persistent storage encryption
description: Implement secure boot processes and encrypt persistent storage on IoT devices to protect against firmware tampering and unauthorized access to stored data. This ensures device integrity from power-on through normal operation.

title_full: IOTSEC03-BP01 Implement authentication and authorization for users accessing IoT resources
title: Implement authentication and authorization for users accessing IoT resources
description: Authenticate and authorize user access to your IoT application by implementing identity federation, multi-factor authentication, and role-based access controls. Ensure users have appropriate permissions to interact with IoT devices and data.

title_full: IOTSEC03-BP02 Decouple access to your IoT infrastructure from the IoT applications
title: Decouple access to your IoT infrastructure from the IoT applications
description: Separate infrastructure access from application access to your IoT system. This separation of concerns ensures that application-level permissions do not grant unintended access to underlying infrastructure components.

title_full: IOTSEC04-BP01 Assign least privilege access to devices
title: Assign least privilege access to devices
description: Apply least privilege principles to device permissions by configuring IoT policies that restrict devices to only the MQTT topics, actions, and resources they need to function. Regularly review and refine device permissions as requirements change.

title_full: IOTSEC05-BP01 Perform certificate lifecycle management
title: Perform certificate lifecycle management
description: Manage device certificates throughout their lifecycle including installation, validation, revocation, and rotation. Implement automated certificate renewal processes to ensure devices maintain valid credentials before expiration.

title_full: IOTSEC06-BP01 Collect and analyze logs and metrics to capture authorization errors and failures to enable appropriate response
title: Collect and analyze logs and metrics to capture authorization errors and failures to enable appropriate response
description: Analyze application and device logs and metrics to detect security issues by collecting and reviewing authorization errors, authentication failures, and anomalous activity patterns. Configure alerts and automated responses for security events.

title_full: IOTSEC06-BP02 Send alerts when security events, misconfiguration, and behavior violations are detected
title: Send alerts when security events, misconfiguration, and behavior violations are detected
description: Configure alerting mechanisms to notify security teams when security events, misconfigurations, or behavior violations are detected in your IoT system. Use AWS IoT Device Defender to set up security profiles and receive alerts for anomalies.

title_full: IOTSEC06-BP03 Alert on non-compliant device configurations and remediate using automation
title: Alert on non-compliant device configurations and remediate using automation
description: Detect and automatically remediate non-compliant device configurations using AWS IoT Device Defender audit checks and mitigation actions. Configure automated responses to bring devices back into compliance with security policies.

title_full: IOTSEC07-BP01 Configure cloud infrastructure to have secure communications
title: Configure cloud infrastructure to have secure communications
description: Configure your AWS organization and accounts with infrastructure protection including secure communications using TLS encryption, VPC endpoints for private connectivity, and network ACLs to control traffic flow to IoT services.

title_full: IOTSEC07-BP02 Define networking configuration which restricts communications to only those ports and protocols which are required
title: Define networking configuration which restricts communications to only those ports and protocols which are required
description: Implement network segmentation and firewall rules that restrict communications to only the ports and protocols required for IoT device operation. Minimize the attack surface by closing unnecessary network paths.

title_full: IOTSEC07-BP03 Log and monitor network configuration changes and network communication
title: Log and monitor network configuration changes and network communication
description: Enable logging and monitoring for network configuration changes and communications. Use VPC Flow Logs, AWS Config, and CloudTrail to track changes and detect unauthorized network activity in your IoT infrastructure.

title_full: IOTSEC08-BP01 Define an automated and monitored mechanism for deploying, managing, and maintaining networks to which IoT devices are connected
title: Define an automated and monitored mechanism for deploying, managing, and maintaining networks to which IoT devices are connected
description: Manage infrastructure into which IoT devices are deployed using automated and monitored mechanisms for network deployment, configuration, and maintenance. Use infrastructure as code to ensure consistent and auditable network configurations.

title_full: IOTSEC08-BP02 Define an automated and monitored mechanism for deploying, managing, and maintaining network configurations for IoT devices
title: Define an automated and monitored mechanism for deploying, managing, and maintaining network configurations for IoT devices
description: Automate the deployment and management of network configurations for IoT devices. Use device management services to push network configuration updates and monitor compliance across your device fleet.

title_full: IOTSEC09-BP01 Manage and maintain IoT Device software using an automated, monitored, and audited mechanism
title: Manage and maintain IoT Device software using an automated, monitored, and audited mechanism
description: Manage and maintain the hardware and software deployed on IoT devices using automated, monitored, and audited mechanisms. Use AWS IoT Jobs for over-the-air updates and track deployment status across your fleet.

title_full: IOTSEC09-BP02 Manage IoT device configuration using automated and controlled mechanisms
title: Manage IoT device configuration using automated and controlled mechanisms
description: Use automated and controlled mechanisms for IoT device configuration management. Implement configuration baselines and drift detection to ensure devices maintain their intended configuration state.

title_full: IOTSEC10-BP01 Use encryption to protect IoT data in transit and at rest
title: Use encryption to protect IoT data in transit and at rest
description: Protect device data at rest and in transit using encryption. Use TLS for communications between devices and the cloud, and encrypt sensitive data stored on devices and in cloud storage using appropriate encryption mechanisms.

title_full: IOTSEC10-BP02 Use data classification strategies to categorize data access based on levels of sensitivity
title: Use data classification strategies to categorize data access based on levels of sensitivity
description: Implement data classification strategies to categorize IoT data based on sensitivity levels. Apply appropriate access controls and protection mechanisms based on data classification to ensure sensitive data receives adequate protection.

title_full: IOTSEC10-BP03 Protect your IoT data in compliance with regulatory requirements
title: Protect your IoT data in compliance with regulatory requirements
description: Ensure IoT data protection meets applicable regulatory requirements such as GDPR, HIPAA, or industry-specific regulations. Implement appropriate data handling, retention, and deletion processes to maintain compliance.

title_full: IOTSEC11-BP01 Build incident response mechanisms to address security events at scale
title: Build incident response mechanisms to address security events at scale
description: Plan the security lifecycle of IoT devices by building incident response mechanisms that can address security events at scale. Define runbooks for common security scenarios and automate response actions where possible.

title_full: IOTSEC11-BP02 Require timely vulnerability notifications and software updates from your providers
title: Require timely vulnerability notifications and software updates from your providers
description: Establish processes to receive timely vulnerability notifications and software updates from device and component providers. Include security update requirements in vendor contracts and maintain awareness of vulnerabilities affecting your IoT components.

title_full: IOTSEC12-BP01 Manage IoT device and gateway source code using source code management tools
title: Manage IoT device and gateway source code using source code management tools
description: Develop, maintain, manage, and deploy application code to IoT devices and gateways using source code management tools. Implement version control, code review processes, and maintain audit trails for all code changes.

title_full: IOTSEC12-BP02 Use static code analysis tools and code scanning to check IoT application code
title: Use static code analysis tools and code scanning to check IoT application code
description: Implement static code analysis and security scanning in your IoT application development pipeline. Identify potential vulnerabilities, security flaws, and coding errors before deploying code to devices.

title_full: IOTSEC12-BP03 Deploy IoT applications using IaC, CI/CD pipelines, and build and deploy automation
title: Deploy IoT applications using IaC, CI/CD pipelines, and build and deploy automation
description: Deploy IoT applications using infrastructure as code (IaC), CI/CD pipelines, and automated build and deployment processes. This ensures consistent, repeatable, and auditable deployments across your IoT infrastructure.

title_full: IOTSEC13-BP01 Use code and package scanning tools during development to identify potential risks during development
title: Use code and package scanning tools during development to identify potential risks during development
description: Identify and remediate risks in IoT device firmware, application code, and dependent packages by using code and package scanning tools during development. Scan for known vulnerabilities in dependencies and libraries.

title_full: IOTSEC13-BP02 Deploy updates to IoT device firmware or software to address identified issues
title: Deploy updates to IoT device firmware or software to address identified issues
description: Deploy firmware and software updates to IoT devices to address identified security issues and vulnerabilities. Use AWS IoT Jobs or similar services to manage updates across your device fleet.

title_full: IOTSEC13-BP03 Identify IoT devices which require updates and schedule updates to those devices
title: Identify IoT devices which require updates and schedule updates to those devices
description: Maintain visibility into which IoT devices require updates and implement processes to schedule and deploy updates. Use fleet indexing and device groups to target specific devices for updates based on their current software versions.

title_full: IOTSEC14-BP01 Establish a security governance team for your IoT applications or extend the security governance team for the organization
title: Establish a security governance team for your IoT applications or extend the security governance team for the organization
description: Govern the security of your IoT applications by establishing a dedicated security governance team or extending your organization's existing security governance capabilities to cover IoT workloads.

title_full: IOTSEC14-BP02 Define security policy so that it can be written into verifiable checks using policy as code techniques
title: Define security policy so that it can be written into verifiable checks using policy as code techniques
description: Define security policies that can be implemented as verifiable checks using policy as code techniques. This enables automated compliance verification and ensures consistent policy enforcement across your IoT infrastructure.

title_full: IOTSEC14-BP03 Implement a risk assessment and risk management process
title: Implement a risk assessment and risk management process
description: Implement formal risk assessment and risk management processes for your IoT applications. Regularly evaluate security risks, prioritize remediation efforts, and track risk mitigation progress.

title_full: IOTSEC15-BP01 Identify the set of relevant regulations for your IoT applications
title: Identify the set of relevant regulations for your IoT applications
description: Identify and document the regulations that apply to your IoT applications based on your industry, geographic locations, and data types processed. Maintain awareness of regulatory changes that may affect your compliance requirements.

title_full: IOTSEC15-BP02 Set up logging and monitoring to support audit checks for compliance
title: Set up logging and monitoring to support audit checks for compliance
description: Configure comprehensive logging and monitoring to support compliance audit requirements. Ensure logs capture required information for demonstrating regulatory compliance and enable audit trail retention according to regulatory requirements.

title_full: IOTSEC15-BP03 Implement automated compliance checking using compliance as code
title: Implement automated compliance checking using compliance as code
description: Implement automated compliance checking using compliance as code techniques. Use AWS Config rules, AWS IoT Device Defender, and custom compliance checks to continuously verify compliance with regulatory requirements.
